zone.line: Wagner
For a shockdog, which it in his manner
Himself at the heels of his master ?plagues
Faust
Obse Mark you how in far circles
He round us here & ever nearer hunts?
And err I not, so draws a whirpool of fire
To his path behind him
Wagner
I see nothing but a black Shock Dog,
It may by you well, a deception of sight be
Faust
To me appears it, that he magic low snares
To the firfth band, round our feet draws
Wagner
I see him uncertain & timorous to us upspring
While he, near his master, two unknown sees
Faust
The circle will close already is it near!
Wagner
Thou seest, a dog & no spectre is there
belly.
He gnarls & hesitates, lays himself on his
